title: Sous Vide Flan Recipe
description: With a sous vide, you can cook flan in individual jars for a simple, custardy dessert that's perfect for company and so easy to clean up.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Custards and Puddings Flan Recipes Sous Vide Flan 4.8 (12) 11 Reviews 8 Photos With a sous vide, you can cook flan in individual jars for a simple, custardy dessert that's perfect for company and so easy to clean up. Submitted by registerednerd Updated on April 16, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 5 mins Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 1 hr 35 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 jars Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings ¬æ cup white sugar 8 4-ounce Mason¬Æ jars with lids and rings 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 3 eggs 1 tablespoon vanilla extract Directions Place a sous vide cooker inside a large heat-proof container filled with water. Preheat the water bath to 179 degrees F (82 degrees C). Melt sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat until browned, about 5 minutes. Pour hot melted sugar into eight 4 ounce Mason jars, enough to cover the bottom of each. Mix sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, eggs, and vanilla extract together in a separate bowl. Add to the jars; seal. Place jars in the water bath and set timer for 1 hour. Remove jars from the water bath. Let flan cool until safe to handle, about 20 minutes. Unseal jars and run a small rubber spatula around the sides of the flan. Top each flan with a plate;invert and gently shake to release. Recipe Tip You can replace vanilla extract with 1 scraped vanilla bean. Add Your Photo Photos of Sous Vide Flan 01 of 08 Photo by¬† Stephanie Albright 02 of 08 Photo by¬† Stephanie Albright 03/26/2025 A keeper! Worth the effort Great flavors Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Absolutely amazing!The perfect silky texture I have always dreamed of.I DID add 1/4 C water after the sugar began to caramelize as another reviewer suggested - so the caramel would become more of a liqueur, and I intentionally went a tiny bit darker as I wanted that "sweetened coffee"‚òï flavor but you can go as light as you like üßë‚Äçüç≥ 03 of 08 Photo by¬† LeahG 09/11/2021 04 of 08 Photo by¬† sedohnah 01/10/2021 Easy and delicious. Adding water to the sugar is a must. Keep a close eye on it, it goes from clear to amber quickly. Will make it again! 05 of 08 Photo by¬† Sharmaine Taaca Leiva 05/26/2020 Easy to follow and very yummy. Hint: Add 1/4 c water to the sugar when caramelizing as suggested by another user but watch carefully. Don‚Äôt want it to burn. 06 of 08 Photo by¬† Stefania 12/15/2019 07 of 08 Photo by¬† Vin 03/05/2019 I almost don‚Äôt have much to say. A super-simple and effective recipe. Flan came out great even though I think I took the sugar slightly past where it should have been (yeah, I was on the edge of burning it. 08 of 08 Photo by¬† registerednerd 12/05/2017 1 You‚Äôll Also Love 7 Absolutely Irresistible Mexican Flan Recipes Microwave Flan 25 Ratings Flan de Queso (Cream Cheese Flan) 64 Ratings Coconut Milk Flan 17 Ratings Pumpkin Flan Coconut Flan 50 Ratings Aracely's Flan 40 Ratings Flan de Coco (Coconut Flan) 128 Ratings Baked Flan 514 Ratings Caramel-Glazed Flan 119 Ratings Creamy Caramel Flan 705 Ratings Super Easy Cream Cheese Flan 5 Ratings White Chocolate Flan 4 Ratings Quesillo (Venezuelan Flan) 6 Ratings Instant Pot Bahn Flan (Vietnamese Flan) Spanish Flan 1,162 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family.
